entries.title: Watch as Justin Trudeau gives a masterclass on why you don't trust politicians calling for gun control
entries.description:
Stop me if you heard this one before: "we're not going after hunters, we are only going after assault weapons/assault riffles/weapons of war." Gun control leftists always say some variation of we're not going after x, we're only going after y. Then x becomes y, and they find a new x. To see this in action, I give you Justin "I Feel Pretty" Trudeau.

Canada's walking pile of soy and hair goop banned handguns in May, and admitted: “the government would seek to come up with one that could not be easily circumvented by gun makers.” In June, he straight up admitted that Canadians don't have a right to self-defense. Hunters and sportsmen? They were in the clear.

Until December.

There are some guns, yes, that we're going to have to take away from people...

"There are some guns that we're going to have to take away from people." Wanted to make sure you caught that.

"...who were using them to hunt But, we're going to also make sure that you're able to buy other guns from a long list of guns that are accepted that are fine for hunting, whether it's rifles or shotguns. We're not going at the right to hunt in this country. We are going at some of the guns used to do it that are too dangerous in other contexts."

Riiiight, You're not going after the right to hunt NOW just like you weren't going after rifles THEN. You were only going after AR-15's. I mean, assault rifles. I mean, assault weapons of war. I mean, handguns. I mean...notice how slippery the slope gets?

President Biden...err, I mean I.F.P. Trudeau thinks we're all stupid and don't see what he's doing. And Trudeau WILL come after hunting because banning eating meat is next on the leftist agenda. It's all a matter of if they'll try calling things an "assault steak."

Editor’s Note

entries.title: Watch: Woman goes bananas, destroys airport when her kids go missing (note: they weren't 'missing')
entries.description:
Here's the thing. I can sympathize with this lady somewhat. Unlike our other instances of it going down at the airport, part of you could feel for this mother. She thought her kids were missing. I would freak out too, ESPECIALLY at the airport. They can be anywhere. And airport employees aren't known to do things like "care" about "you" or "anything."

That's if my kids were really missing, though. We'll get to that in a bit. I'd hate to give away the ending this early.

Miami, Florida.— (@ppv_tahoe) Woman arrested after destroying several computers inside the terminal at Miami International Airport. | MIA pic.twitter.com/2hXfRnCA9y
— PPV-TAHOE - News Journalist (@ppv_tahoe) December 21, 2022

There is a key part of this video missing. It's the part when this woman told the airport employee, "Excuse me, but I am unable to find my children." Something happened at that moment that causes this mother to lather herself up in a rage, destroy anything she could get her hands on, and eventually find herself arrested. Perhaps the employee didn't seem bothered that there were missing children. It could be the airport employee was going on break and wasn't even supposed to be there that day as it was. Or, they were just an obnoxious jackwagon.

The rub is the kids weren't MISSING in the lost or trafficking sense. They were "missing" in the finger-quotes sense. They never told their mother they had to make poo-poos. From the crack reporting team over at Outkick:

After literally ripping down an entire computer stand, rolling around on the ground, and throwing keyboards at unsuspecting employees, Camila found the kids: they wandered off to the Porta John (that’s a fancy word for ‘bathroom’ in Florida and Alabama) without telling her.

Christmas is canceled, kids. Your Paw Patrol and Monster's High dolls need to be returned to pay for bail, because SOMEONE couldn't say, "Mom, we'll be right back."

Editor’s Note

entries.title: Watch: Little king isn't happy to be on the naughty list and what he'll do to Santa Claus is hysterical
entries.description:
Our parents used Santa Claus to keep us in line during the holidays. If we acted up, we were told Santa put us on the naughty list and that we weren't getting any presents. The payoff was that as we got older, we were allowed to then torture our kids in the same way. Or you're someone like Uncle Brodigan who, when his nieces and nephew are told Santa thinks they're bad, calls Santa himself and says it's all Fake News.

This little kid was NOT having it when he was told he's on the naughty list. And then he issued threats. I'm fairly certain this is not a new video. But it's the first I've seen it, and I can't stop laughing.

For the sake a peace across the land and the safety of Santa Claus, please pray this kid landed on the good list. pic.twitter.com/RUAfJlQntj
— Louder with Crowder Dot Com (@LWCnewswire) December 21, 2022
"Father Christmas is not being very nice to me."

Father Christmas is the UK's version of Santa, in case you couldn't tell by the accents. Which, as an aside, and since it's Wednesday and I know what that means, Chris Jericho has a killer cover of Father Christmas.

The conversation continued, at which point Lil' Badass Jones was informed that Father Christmas said he's on the naughty list. This is where the kid loses it.

"Then I will do an uppercut to him. I'll punch him. I'll punch his beard off. Trust me. I'm not on the bad list."

Santa's around the world have shown they can be hardcore themselves. In recent history, we've seen Santa take down car thieves and bust up illegal drug rings. I'd steer clear of this kid, though. Just give him whatever he asked for, then move on to the next house.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: Santa Claus applies to become a concealed carry holder and leftists are crying 'bah humbug' over it
entries.description:
It's rough out there this Christmas season. In liberal cities across America, people suffering from the pandemic are taking advantage of liberal laws that have made stealing legal-ish. At least, anything under a thousand bucks. It's gotten so bad, Santa Claus has decided to protect himself. He strolled into the El Paso County Sheriff's Office in Colorado. I'm assuming he was in town to give mall Santas performance evaluations. Santa applied for his concealed handgun permit, and got it! It's not every day you see Santa Claus wanting a gun.

The sheriff's office celebrated this rare occasion. It's a tweet from last year, but it still cracks me up.

Guess who came in to receive his Concealed Handgun Permit today? 🎅

Did you know the El Paso County Sheriff's Office has issued 49,750 Concealed Handgun Permits with another 2,560 awaiting to be issued?

For more info please visit our website: https://t.co/AbGrPigOUZ pic.twitter.com/ELmffXcfjA
— EPCSheriff (@EPCSheriff) December 3, 2021

Not everyone is happy with Kris Kringle being able to protect himself. As the New York Post reports, random idiots on Twitter are outraged:

"Santa has a fvcking [sic] gun is what you’re going with? Should I show my child this pic? Will it comfort them? Will they love Santa more? Who is this tweet for?"

"Posting this tells me your professional judgment is impaired."

"What is your message to children here? There is enough anxiety among children already."

The sheriff's department was forced to clarify they were just trying to spread some yuletide cheer to their hardworking staff. And that they apologize to anyone who was offended.

EPSO intended to highlight our staff in the Concealed Handgun Permit Office, not to be insensitive. Santa correlates to the month of December and we thought he would help to recognize our hard working staff.
— EPCSheriff (@EPCSheriff) December 3, 2021

I'm happy for Santa Claus and am glad he's taking precautions. I don't know if they have a second amendment in the North Pole. But we have one in America. Santa Claus has the most important job on the planet. All the good little girls and boys are counting on him to bring presents. If the bad little girls and boys think they are going to take the presents from themselves, Santa has a present waiting just for them. Merry Christmas!

Editor’s Note

entries.title: Coalminers, Florida, and Digging Your Own Grave: Here are our top blog posts of 2022
entries.description:
It was a year where Ron DeSantis and Elon Musk were both iconic in their own way, a old woman showed courage and a coal miner showed the love between a father and a son. Also, a pedophile was forced to dig his own grave. These were the top ten blog posts for 2022.

One behalf of all of us here at the Louder with Crowder Dot Com website, thank you for your continues support. You keep reading, we'll keep writing!

10. Watch: Mom dresses like drag queen at school board meeting to make point about what's appropriate for kids

"In an effort to teach children about tolerance and acceptance, school boards have been hiring men to dress like women and dance for those children. Prior to 2022, these drag shows with men who call themselves "queens" were meant to entertain middle-aged suburban women in bars at Bingo night. I guess one of those women sat on a school board and felt this entertainment was perfect for children. Drag queens became the measuring stick to determine if you are woke or just another solve for X-phobe."

9. Oh-My: Elon Musk Clowns AOC Over Latest Anti-Billionaire Rant, Makes Her Look Silly With His Response

"It was bound to happen. Elon Musk, who owns Twitter, mixed it up with social media influencer Rep. AOC, who tweets a lot. Now Elon owns Rep. AOC as well. Like many overdramatic social media influencers, Rep. AOC announced to the world at one point that she was leaving Twitter. Only to come back the next day to cyberbully one of her female colleagues. Today the social media influencer found herself bodied, BTFO'd, clapped back, and rekt by Musk."

8. Professor Savages Critical Race Theory Proponents on the Dr. Phil Show in Only Two Minutes

"You may have heard of James Lindsay before. He was a member of the trio of academics who demonstrated just how ridiculous the peer review process has become in the humanities and grievance studies disciplines. eedless to say, Lindsay harbors a certain level of disdain for things like CRT and rightfully so. What’s more, he’s far more intelligent than any CRT advocate could ever hope to be, so he wipes the floor with people. And during a recent appearance on the Dr. Phil Show, he didn’t disappoint at all!"

7. Watch: Drew Barrymore is being race shamed for frolicking in the rain. No, really. This is a thing today.

"We may have reached the most absurd internet outrage in the history of internet outrages. Which, thanks to retweets from both Yashar Ali and Libs of TikTok, things are only going to go downhill from here. Drew Barrymore posted a video on the communist Chinese-owned app TikTok of her frolicking in the rain. Another TikTok user found her clip to be racially insensitive, because... actually, just watch."

6. Watch: CNN Tricked Into Broadcasting Fake and Vulgar Tweets on New Years Eve

"I'm sure many of you missed this on New Year's Eve. Dollars to donuts whatever you were doing, you were not watching CNN. Just because, eww gross. But at least two people were. One of them created enough fake Twitter accounts to troll the broadcast, in a prank that would have landed him on our 2021 list of "Everyday Heroes, Legends, and Patriots Who Just 'Don't Give a F***'." The other was the person who recorded the troll's handy work and shared it on social media for our enjoyment."

5. Ron DeSantis Continues Dominance of Disney, Reacts to Leaked Video of Disney Corporate President

"Disney is going bananas over Florida legislation they didn't care about until employees whined. Yes, THAT BILL. The Parental Rights in Education/Don't Say Gay/Anti-Grooming Bill: it depends on your mood. An all-hands meeting was called at the Mouse House to discuss how they were going to handle it. Video leaked to rabble-rouser Christopher Rufo. Tucker Carlson showed a clip of Disney Corporate President Karey Burke to Ron DeSantis. Surprising to no one, DeSantis was not amused."

4. Hell Yeah, Brother: Lynyrd Skynyrd Singer Records Rocking New Anthem for Ron DeSantis

"When a 1977 plane crash robbed the world of Ronnie Van Zant, his brother Johnny Van Zant stepped up as the new lead singer of Lynyrd Skynyrd. Johnny is stepping up again, this time with a new anthem for another Floridian badass, "America's Governor" Ron DeSantis. Van Zant is Johnny's other band with brother Donnie Van Zant, the lead singer of .38 Special, another badass band. There is nothing but badassery happening here."

3. Touching photo of coal miner taking son to basketball game goes viral, and now the coach is getting involved

"Here's a touching palate cleanser to end the day. The Kentucky Wildcats hosted their annual "blue-white scrimmage" when a father and son caught the eye of Coach John Calipari. The father, a coal miner, sat there with his face still covered in coal dust while his son looked excited to be at the game and with his dad. Coach Calipari snapped a photo and tweeted 'My family’s American dream started in a Clarksburg, WV coal mine, so this picture hits home. From what I’ve been told, after his shift, he raced to be with his son & watch our team.'"

2. Watch: Ukrainian Woman Gives Russian Soldier Sunflower Seeds So Flower Can Grow When He Dies on Ukraine Soil

If there was a Ukraine version of Matt Damon's "how do you like them apples" line from Good Will Hunting, it would be said by this badass Ukrainian woman. She walked up to an occupying Russian soldier to give him a gift of sunflower seeds. No, not to eat. To keep in his pocket. That way a beautiful flower can grow when his dead corpse lies on Ukrainian soil. I'm counting on Twitter to provide an accurate translation here. I'll provide my own after the video.

1. Hero: Dad Forces Man Who Sexually Abused Daughter to Dig His Own Grave

"After discovering videos on his friend Oleg Sviridov’s cell phone, the father took Sviridov out into the woods before forcing him to dig his own shallow grave. Now, he maintains that he did this just to scare him, to convince him to turn himself into the police. But during the event, as described by the father, Oleg attempted to attack the father, and in the course of the altercation, took a knife from the man and stabbed himself in the chest after he “realized he had nothing to live for.”

Editor’s Note

entries.title: Elon Musk responds to stepping down as Twitter CEO, and...BAH GAWD, that's MySpace Tom's entrance music
entries.description:
Elon Musk got lost in his feels over the weekend. He was at the World Cup paling around with Jared Kushner, people kept chirping him over suspending journaismers and other useless people. Musk was all like, "FINE! If you want me gone, take my poll!" Which, a) that's what she said, b) over 17 million people took Elon's poll, and c) that's what she said again.

Should I step down as head of Twitter? I will abide by the results of this poll.
— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) December 18, 2022

Everyone waited with bated breath to hear Elon's response. News-entertainment content provider CNN couldn't think of anything else to talk about.

CNN's continuing wall-to-wall coverage of Elon Musk's Twitter poll is so gripping I barely even remember what twitter files ARE! Stellar stuff.
— Caleb Howe (@CalebHowe) December 20, 2022

The Chief Twit broke his silence. He will resign as CEO as soon as he finds someone foolish enough to take the job. Then, out of the white noise creating a hiss of ten thousand little things, a voice called out. A voice we haven't heard in quite some time...

Depends who you get to run it ! 🤔
— Tom Anderson (@myspacetom) December 19, 2022


pic.twitter.com/dTuuadUUVn
— Tom Anderson (@myspacetom) December 21, 2022

MYSPACE TOM IS BACK, BAY-BEE!!!

Only one man can save us now... pic.twitter.com/DRQ7lujx9h
— Louder with Crowder Dot Com (@LWCnewswire) December 21, 2022

Social media was so much simpler when Tom was running sh*t. No censorship. No election interference. He just wanted us to have profiles with our favorite songs and bedazzled .gifs. Should we choose, a blog option was available, where some of us would say something nice about George W. Bush and every liberal we've ever known would freak out on us for it. The only real drama created was IRL, when your friends would get upset they weren't in your Top 8.

Then, as the meme says, Tom got his bag and bounced. In 2005, News Corp said, "here's $580 million." Tom said, "Deuces." Never to be seen again until a cameo in the 2009 Adam Sandler movie Funny People.

One could chalk this up to trolling. Or MySpace Tom having a laugh. Here's the thing though...unless I'm reading things wrong, those are Tom's only tweets since 2021. His second-to-last tweet? Was a response to Elon Musk.

Excited to be a SpaceX investor 🚀
— Tom Anderson (@myspacetom) June 25, 2021

Elon says he needs someone crazy enough to take the CEO's job. Tom Anderson might be crazy enough. Could Tom be every bit as "commie as f*ck" as everyone else who works in and runs Big Tech companies? Perhaps. But he'd be working for Elon.

Tom has been gone from us long enough. 2023, it's time for the comeback.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: Watch: Rand Paul parodies 'Night Before Christmas' to destroy the ginormous crap sandwich known as the Omnibus
entries.description:
I'll be honest, I don't have the bandwidth to get emotional over the Omnibus spending bill. In a year where we've been told to be okay with the feds paying Twitter to censor Americans and public schools teaching children about "vagina slime," seeing Congress pull the same bullsh*t they pull every year -- where they do nothing for eleven months and then cram all their unpopular budget requests in one 4000 page bill they don't read -- meh. We all know what happens next. It happens every year.

That said, one of the few real ones when it comes to calling out this ginormous crap sandwich is Senator Rand Paul. He explained the process as only he can...by reading "'Twas the Night Before Christmas."

🎄 I wrote and performed my own scary version of 'Twas the Night Before Christmas 🎄 Enjoy! pic.twitter.com/IHI0uNyW0N
— Rand Paul (@RandPaul) December 20, 2022

But like I said, I'm choosing not to be outraged over our "leaders" sneaking bullplop they know wouldn't survive sunlight. We've all already been there and done that this year. But were I to get outraged, paying for border security for OTHER COUNTRIES while forbidding our own border patrol from securing our own border would be something.

...but at the same time, allocates $410 million towards border security for Jordan, Lebanon, Egypt, Tunisia, and Oman.

America Last in action. pic.twitter.com/KSkgtTEtmL
— Rep. Dan Bishop (@RepDanBishop) December 20, 2022

Over a billion on globalism might be something else.

And, of course, $1,438,000,000 for membership in global multilateral organizations, including the UN. pic.twitter.com/LHjDYXG2Us
— Rep. Dan Bishop (@RepDanBishop) December 20, 2022

Of course, Zelenskyy is getting his allowance.

If an additional $47 billion in Ukraine funding isn't enough for you, the bill also authorizes a "Ukrainian Independence Park" right here in DC. pic.twitter.com/vDoAcT7INZ
— Rep. Dan Bishop (@RepDanBishop) December 20, 2022

This sounds gross and Orwellian.

On a more sinister note, here's at least $575 million for "family planning" in areas where population growth "threatens biodiversity."

Malthusianism is a disturbing, anti-human ideology that should have ZERO place in any federal program. pic.twitter.com/7EfFx2pq0M
— Rep. Dan Bishop (@RepDanBishop) December 20, 2022

And of course, over eleven billion more for the feds. Which, if you've been reading the Twitter Files...no.

$11.33 billion for the FBI.

$1.75 billion for the ATF.

& $2.63 billion for US Attorneys, with an emphasis on J6 prosecutions and domestic terrorism cases.

All with significant increases from the previous year.
— Rep. Dan Bishop (@RepDanBishop) December 20, 2022

Those are things that, should I have chosen to be outraged over the ginormous crap sandwich known as the Omnibus bill, I'd be upset about. Until our allegedly conservative leaders start to show outrage -- real outrage, not just mugging for right-wing media cameras -- I'll stick to Christmas baking today.
